website_summaries.verdict: This highly-recommended rotary hammer is a good buy at this price. Best for small commercial projects.
pros: Delivers fast drilling and chipping speed
Active Vibration Control reduces vibration in handles
Integral clutch reduces sudden, high-torque reactions
Package includes a depth rod, 360 side handle, and a kit box
cons: Drilling mode might change unexpectedly during operation

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful, durable, high-quality workhorse. Exceptional customer satisfaction ratings and great value.
pros: Handles tough jobs at home or on-site
cons: A little on the heavy side
Can jump out of mode during use

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rotary hammer. Perfect for small jobs and chores. Tons of power
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to get tile off of the floor. The tile had been bonded to the underlying cement for about 25 years. I try to hammer and a chisel and what a waste of time. I didn't want to get the best hammer chisel in the world, but wanted something that would work and allow me use it over the following years whenever I needed it. This one has plenty of power. It seems to have no trouble pounding the chisel and elevating the tile. I also got the Bosch chisel  highly recommended. Does a great job. If you need a hammer chisel and don't want to spend a fortune, I would highly recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: There’s no substitute for a REAL hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tools that isn’t useful for a lot, but it’s THE tool for certain jobs. I bought this because my Dewalt cordless multi function drill / “hammer” drill / screw gun couldn’t get more than about 1/2” deep in my concrete floor after 2 minutes and running the battery out. Well this machine drilled through the entire 3.5” slab down to dirt before I even knew what happened! Oops! Make sure to set the depth gauge so you don’t get a surprise! It’s a work horse and I expect for my purposes I expect I’ll be buried with it and many of my other corded yellow power tools.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swindells

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend this highly
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my 2nd purchase of this same drill. I bought the first one in 2006 and used it on a regular, almost daily, basis since then. It took an absolute pounding going into 120-year old hand-kilned brick (which is much tougher than today's bricks), CMU, and concrete slab (among other things) and just kept on ticking. Can't recommend this highly enough
customer_reviews.author: Dhiggs

customer_reviews.title: Great chipping hammer
customer_reviews.text: I am remodeling my kitchen and needed to remove 12 x 12 ceramic tile. I tried a chisel and hammer but it took too long. Based on reviews, I purchased the 1-1/8" Rotary hammer. With a tile bit, it took about an hour to take up 150 SF of tile. I have not used it as a hammer drill but I am sure it will perform as wall as a chipping hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Scubadave

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of equipment.....high quality and durable. Used this with a tile chisel to remove 200 square feet of tile and thin set while remodeling our master bathroom. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rice

customer_reviews.title: drilling in concrete and brick is like a hot knife in butter
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my 20v Dewalt 1/2" hammer drill for small holes in concrete (1/4-1/2") and it takes forever (15-20min). Decided to upgrade when a 1/8" hole took 25 min last time i used. With this rotary hammer, drilling in concrete and brick is like a hot knife in butter. Wow, it's so easy now. I no longer dread drilling in masonry.
customer_reviews.author: LanMan

customer_reviews.title: Built tough
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done. Built tough. Bought this to remove 400 sq. ft. of tiles and brick wall. Tiles were double caked on to cement boards that were caked and nailed (2-4 inch spacing). It took a beating, but tool 1, tiles and brick 0. 3 inch angle chisel really helps. Recommended long shank. Some reviews were noting about overheating at rubber shock absorber. Didn't experience it at 30-90 minutes between stops. Motor did get hot as most dewalt tools do. While most of my tools are dewalt, it one of a couple things I don't like about dewalt tools...power hogs.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammer drill for concrete.
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy this to install a pool safety cover and drill 30 holes in some old concrete. I borrowed a cordless dewalt hammer drill, and a plug in black and decker. Neither could touch the concrete. The dewalt could knock out one 3/4”, 2” deep hole in about 10 min, then it would need to rest. Black and decker, nothing. This thing? Like a hot knife in butter. It blew me away, I drilled 5 holes in a row, probably about 10-15 sec each and this thing wasn’t breaking a sweat. Definition of beast mode.
customer_reviews.author: Art Vandelay

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money, awesome rotary hammer
customer_reviews.text: This tool really impressed me especially when combined with the Dewalt Rock Carbide SDS Plus Hammer Bits. Only light pressure is needed to quickly drill through concrete and has the nice shock grip. If you take all the travel out of the shock handle pressing forward then you are pressing too hard. The drill is plenty fast and after about an hour of constant use the housing was fairly warm but not excessively hot. This rotary hammer will definitely replace my old hammer drill. It is so much better and really amazing to see how much better tools have gotten in the last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ron H

customer_reviews.title: Be conscious of grease leaving areas it shouldn't be.
customer_reviews.text: Like the shock absorber compared to others. Outside of that, the unit I received failed badly. After about 2 hours of use, grease started to seep out of the selector switch. Soon after, my bit broke off inside the drill. Unrelated, but nonetheless, I couldn't release the bit rendering it useless. Contacted DeWalt and they gave me return instructions. Ended up intending to rent a rotary hammer to finish my job. Got to Home Depot and noticed every one of theirs are Makita. I asked why. Their answer was, because they last. I ended up just buying a new Makita and knocked out the remaining 2/3 of the job like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Keller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ceramic tile remover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool and used it along with a 3-in Wide Machine Sharpened Tile & THINSET REMOVAL BIT, SDS Plus!!! (3" X 10") bit to blast through ceramic tile with ease. I will be putting this dynamic duo to work next weekend too. Here are the before and after photos.
customer_reviews.author: D. LAWRENCE

customer_reviews.title: Kicks butt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was struggling to drill holes in concrete with a standard 1/2 hammer drill and Tapcon bit. I purchased the SDS Rotary hammer and some Bosch bits out of desperation. With this combo I can drill a 3/16 hole in seconds where the old Makita 1/2" hammer drill and Tapcon bit took minutes. With 100s of holes to drill finishing a basement this is a huge difference. I never used an SDS drill before. There is a lot of difference between this and a hammer drill from a big box store. This thing really hammers like a mini demolition hammer. Comparatively my old hammer drill just sort of vibrated/buzzed.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one YEARS ago!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this DeWalt hammer drill! If you have any holes to drill in concrete or brick, or if you have to chisel ANYTHING (even works well on frozen caribou), or even mundane chores like drilling holes in wood (with the proper bit)- you can't go wrong with this. It drills (with or without the hammer action), or hammers with or without drilling- and you won't kill any batteries or yourself using it.
customer_reviews.author: Egon, in Ittoqqortoormiit, Greenland

customer_reviews.title: Hammer time!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a must-have for renos IMO. I've had it for 3 months and already got my money's worth. Drills through CMU walls like butter. Removed entire bathroom tile floor in 20mins. (update) A year later and a ton of reno and this thing is still going strong. Got my moneys worth many times over already. I had to do a large bust up in the master bath slab and instead rented the large SDS-Max jackhammer for a day (27lb) but still the hammer-drill tool was used a lot after the bulk hole was done. But dont be afraid to rent the bigger tool for a day...it's a pretty cheap rental and is even faster!
customer_reviews.author: Colin MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: This really feels like a quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove the old tiles on my kitchen counter without removing all the wood trim. DEWALT makes quality products, so I am inclined to buy that brand, and have done so for quite a few years. When I needed a Rotary Hammer, I checked this one out and I was not disappointed! It gave me the control I needed to get into tight places without tearing everything up. It saved me hours of time, and our new kitchen counter looks wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Rory George

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable tool for drilling in solid concrete and/or rock
customer_reviews.text: Works great, tried to drill holes into poured and hardened concrete to set anchors with an 18V hammer drill and some smaller diameter so called concrete bits (they should have been called mortar bits because as soon as they hit an aggregate they stopped dead). Coupled with SDS+ concrete/rock bits, this thing plowed through set concrete and solid rock. I pre-drilled with 1/2" bit and then used a 3/4" bit, filled the hole with hydraulic cement and set my anchors - worked great.
customer_reviews.author: uncle jessie

customer_reviews.title: Leaking oil with first use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this several months ago, tried it out to be sure it worked and put it away to use on a future project. We have used it today, first time as the time for the project is now. Leaking oil . Aside from this , it is working. Of course return window has closed. Lesson learned. NEVER buy expensive tools from Amazon EVER as you have no recourse if something goes wrong. If it had been purchased at Home Depot or Lowes, it would have been no problem to return. NEVER AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: Debbi L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well, it is not a HIlti, but it is not the Hilti price either. It performs extremely well, much better than my old Milwaukee. I tested it out of the box on a rock known to be impenetrable by my old Milwaukee, less than 45 seconds I was 4" in to the rock with a nice clean hole 3/8" in diameter. Since then I have used it on concrete floors and meets all my expectations. The depth gauge is a little cheesy but I would seldom use it anyway. Good purchase! I also bought the DEWALT DW5470 5-Piece Rock Carbide SDS Plus.
customer_reviews.author: WW in MT

customer_reviews.title: A Mighty Mite!!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews while making my decision on which hammer drill to buy. I had ordered curbs for my garage to avoid pulling in too far. They required 3 drilled holes in the garage foundation. I looked at cordless drills but once you add the cost of the charger kit you've practically bought another drill. This baby went through the concrete like a hot knife through butter. I'm very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Had to rip up an old bathroom tile floor installed with thick set. Worked like a charm. Took about 6 hrs total for 50 sq ft floor. Used the Bosch tile chisel bit. No fatigue or vibration issues. Next for some concrete drilling.
customer_reviews.author: gilbert stock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. Very impressed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a beauty. It out performed a big heavy duty chipping hammer with a 3 inch blade and a thinset blade. I used a 1.5 inch bit to chip up my tile and thinset and my cousin who used the heavy duty chipping hammer was getting blown away and killing himself versus my Dewalt. I also love the fact that my hands aren't shaking like I have parkinsons or something after chipping for so long as it had an anti vibration feature. I highly recommend this tool for small and big jobs. I wish they made a 3 inch blade for it though and a thinset blade that would have made the job go even faster.
customer_reviews.author: David valente

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for concrete drilling.
customer_reviews.text: I had been struggling to make even a dent in my concrete walls with my cordless "hammer drill", leading me to something with more power. The expression of a warm knife through butter fits perfectly. I made short work of any concrete that needed to be drilled. I would highly recommend to anyone needing this for their inventory.
customer_reviews.author: AvidExplorer

customer_reviews.title: It is a heavier but it might be a good advantage.
customer_reviews.text: Break up concrete. Drill holes in concrete to mount railing. This machine is up to the job. The handle is takes up the vibration. It is heavier than others but the weight is added to the force push onto the work piece. I think it is the advantage. It punch holes in concrete quickly. Work great for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: Must have Tool for Concrete Projects
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the ability to switch from the normal drill mode to hammer drill mode and then strictly just hammering I just installed a wooden handrail to my front steps which set on a concrete foundation, so I drilled into the concrete to install my anchor bolts to support the 4x4 posts and was like cutting through butter You won’t be disappointed with this Hammer Drill ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Used this for busting up marble tile and thinset. I had borrowed some much higher dollar hammer drills before this was delivered. This thing definitely held it's own ground. Chipped everything up just as well as the $700 machines. Highly recommended for any demo jobs for sure!
customer_reviews.author: gary long

customer_reviews.title: It works and very fast
customer_reviews.text: Drilling a hole through concrete is slicing through butter with a hot knife. I was drilling holes to anchor pillars for a pergola. Impact driver could not even scratch the surface. Bought this and in seconds 6 inch holes were dug.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: makes life easier 100% cant believe it took me so long to get one from dewalt.
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with one unit, the hammer action didn't properly engaged, was replaced with a second unit, and works like a champ. Can't imagine how long would it take me to finished a tile removal with other tools ( hammer and chisel)
customer_reviews.author: Asony

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill, but there is a reason this is ...
customer_reviews.text: Needs more torque for 1/2" bits longer than 16 inches. Nice drill, but there is a reason this is cheaper than the more costly rotary hammer drills. Nice hammer drill, but it isn't the super heavy duty model!
customer_reviews.author: E. R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this tool for a master bath renovation we were doing. Did a great job removing the tile, good job removing the thin-set. Great tool but you have to manage it, like a mini jack hammer. Also did a great job setting concrete anchors into existing concrete. Really happy with the tool and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CrimsonJo

customer_reviews.title: A very handy tool to own.
customer_reviews.text: Chipped out my home slab for a bathroom remodel. Probably 2 by 6 feet over all of 30-year-old 4-5 inch thick concrete. Took some time (and the correct tool) but worked superbly. Have also used to quickly drill 1/2 inch holes through home slab for termite treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S Ford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for brick tear down, bit kit separate
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like... it's a DeWalt. Delivered as stated. I used it right away to take down a large/wide brick chimney. Make sure you order bits you need, doesn't come with them. Love the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Tool
customer_reviews.text: I tried over and over with standard impact bits (destroyed 3 or 4) and an impact driver and could not drill the necessary holes in my concrete to use Tapcon screws. The SDS driver and bit drilled them effortlessly. It's an incredible tool that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Boatdave

customer_reviews.title: This drill was a complete surprise and delight to use
customer_reviews.text: This drill was a complete surprise and delight to use. As many other reviewers have indicated it drilled through stone and concrete like butter. The shock absorber handle really cut down on the vibrations felt. There is no substitute for having the right tool for the job and you can be sure this is it. Now I'm just trying to find another project to use it on.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi L

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a hammer drill, I had others and this one gets the job done fast. Even through metal lentils is a breeze, you might want to take if off hammer drills for Tapcon installation in soft or new concrete block.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat emptor

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and comfortable to use. Drove a 7" by 3/4" bit into cured concrete to set anchors in less than a minute with no effort. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I used this drill to install a railing it drilled 8 1/4 inch holes in concrete in 3 minutes it was the easiest part of the whole job
customer_reviews.author: joseph mcguire

customer_reviews.title: loves
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for father and well he loves it :) very good power tool, well made, strong should last a life time.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Had to drill through 36" of solid concrete - this drill made it seem easy!
customer_reviews.text: I used this rotary hammer drill to bore through two 36" deep solid concrete columns - it made, what had previously seemed like an impossible job, easy! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning Mortar Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean a 7cuft paddle mortar mixer out before installing new rubber paddles on the arms. Works great! Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I like all of dewalt products. I have a set of these products and I am very pleased with them. I do not use often and only at home
customer_reviews.author: Elshad

customer_reviews.title: much better then hammer drill.
customer_reviews.text: Great small rotary hammer. Don't use a hammer drill for concrete, this rotary makes much cleaner and faster holes. Saves time and gives much more professional looking results then a hammer drill. Holes that took 2-3 minutes now take 30 seconds. Dewalt builds a quality product that I hope lasts years to come.
customer_reviews.author: jiminkeys

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My first attempt at drilling in concrete, went really well, the old statement to get the right tool for the job was never more right.
customer_reviews.author: Brick

customer_reviews.title: a great value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to set up for hammer, rotary hammer or rotary and low shock to the operator's hands and arms
customer_reviews.author: desertgolfer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great drill. Goes through concrete like butter. Used it to drill 3" holes in drywall and 1/2" plywood.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It broke just after 30 days and Dewalts customer service was overran the entire time I was trying to contact them to validate if I could just get refunded as I could not wait around to finish my project. No call backs and zero ability to speak with anyone. Very disappointed with any claim to warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisandCheryl Ward

customer_reviews.title: Tile removal made easier
customer_reviews.text: Been pulling up tile in my house...this was a lifesaver...well at least a back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Gattis

customer_reviews.title: Leaking oil
customer_reviews.text: It was leaking oil from inside to outside. Not sure if it is normally or just my unlucky. I need to replace it. But overall I love Dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Shane W

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use... mostly. Does not have a level. You will need to plan accordingly. Drills through concrete as cleanly as you can with any drill. Makes the job easier.
customer_reviews.author: Avatar Farms

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt is simply the best had this 3 years now and it’s running like brand new still
customer_reviews.author: steffon

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings, see review.
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this tool. It's extremely durable and well-built, and I think you could probably drill through about anything. The unit I received however has a tendency to slip out of whatever mode you set it on to the next mode. For instance, I wanted it on hammer drill, and during use it slipped into hammer- only mode. I have set it on drill mode, and it has slipped out of that during hard use. That was a major problem for the project I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Hobie CatTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I could kick myself for not buying this sooner. Needed to drill 5/8" holes into a 65 year old concrete slab. This took care of it in about 5 seconds a hole. Super simple to get going. Haven't used the hammer-only mode yet, but plan to do so with a chisel soon.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It works miracles. It is just too heavy for me.
customer_reviews.author: RLP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and removes tile and cement board fast.
customer_reviews.text: The shock absorber feature works great. Tool is a bit heavy, but very easy to use. We took out 2 stone bathroom floors and the cement board.
customer_reviews.author: Dublin

customer_reviews.title: Really good for taking out tile and the concrete subfloor
customer_reviews.text: Really good for taking out tile and the concrete subfloor
customer_reviews.author: LindsvanleerTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: DEWALT Rotary Hammer Drill with Shocks, D-Handle, SDS, 1-1/8-Inch (D25263K)
product_meta.description: Style:Rotary Hammer| Size:1-1/8"The D25263K 1-1/8-inch D-Handle SDS Rotary Hammer with SHOCKS offers 3 Joules of impact energy for fast drilling and chipping speed. It has a 8.5 Amp high performance motor for all your needs, and also features SHOCKS active vibration control and regulation, resulting in reduced vibration felt in the handles - a Perform & Protect feature. This Rotary Hammer has a rotating brush ring which delivers full speed/torque in forward and reverse, along with an integral clutch that reduces sudden, high torque reactions if bit jams. Includes: Rotary Hammer, 360 Side Handle, Depth Rod, Kit Box.
feature_bullets: SHOCKS - Active Vibration Control, reduced vibration felt in the handles. A Perform & Protect feature
Integral clutch reduces sudden, high torque reactions
Rotating brush ring delivers full speed/torque in forward and reverse

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
